result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • James J John Jr was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • James J John Jr was found guilty of Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under the Influence of Intoxicant), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this OWIPP.
Order GRANTING a request to extend the time to pay the fine, costs and surcharges in this action, signed and filed.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Michael J. Hanrahan, Br. 4, calendar successor, for review. spc
LETTER REQUESTING A PAYMENT PLAN   RECEIVED AND FILED   CH

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:  COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 5 DAYS, STRAIGHT TIME,  in the House of Correction, to run concurrent as to each count with credit for 2 days time served.  REPORT DATE 09-21-2015 BY 09:00 AM. 

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:
*  Pay costs, surcharges assessments, supervision fees due on or before 09-15-2016. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Pay a fine of $350.00 plus costs due on or before 09-15-2016. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  12 Months suspension of driver's privileges with a $60.00 reinstatement fee.
*  12 Months Ignition Interlock Device.

Received and filed with court:
*  Sentencing Referral Form
*  Court Order IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan Form

ADDRESS INFO for James J John Jr
Current: 3303 W. Layton Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53221   (Effective: 09-15-2015)
Prior: 2868A South 16th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Defendant James J John in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNT 1:   Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  On motion of the State Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED.

AS TO COUNT 3:    Defendant waived rights and pled NO CONTEST.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Parties are prepared to proceed with sentencing.

Defendant James J John in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests an adjourned plea/sentencing date. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James J John in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
No driving without a valid license.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, and no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James J John in court with attorney Scott Douglas Connors.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reseve Judge, Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/20/15 @ 1:30pm
